connector.description:
Receive data from AWS SQS.

Access Key/Secret Key are the basic method for authenticating to the AWS SQS Service. These parameters are optional because the Kamelet provides the 'useDefaultCredentialsProvider'.

When using a default Credentials Provider the SQS client will load the credentials through this provider and won't use the static credential. This is reason for not having the access key and secret key as mandatory parameter for this Kamelet.

Two headers will be duplicated with different names for clarity at sink level, CamelAwsSqsMessageId will be duplicated into aws.sqs.message.id and CamelAwsSqsReceiptHandle will be duplicated in aws.sqs.receipt.handle

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueNameOr.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueNameOrArn
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueNameOr.description: The SQS Queue Name or ARN

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.autoCreateQ.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.autoCreateQueue
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.autoCreateQ.description: Setting the autocreation of the SQS queue.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.amazonAWSHo.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.amazonAWSHost
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.amazonAWSHo.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.protocol.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.protocol
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.protocol.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS Example: http or https

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueURL.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueURL
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.queueURL.description: The full SQS Queue URL (required if using KEDA)

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useDefaultC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useDefaultC.description: If true, the SQS client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useProfileC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useProfileC.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useSessionC.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.useSessionC.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in SQS.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.profileCred.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.profileCred.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.sessionToke.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.sessionToke.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.uriEndpoint.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.uriEndpointOverride
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.uriEndpoint.description: The overriding endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also select the `overrideEndpoint` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.overrideEnd.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.overrideEndpoint
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.overrideEnd.description: Select this option to override the endpoint URI. To use this option, you must also provide a URI for the `uriEndpointOverride` option.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.delay.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.delay
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.delay.description: The number of milliseconds before the next poll of the selected stream

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.greedy.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.greedy
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.greedy.description: If greedy is enabled, then the polling will happen immediately again, if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.maxMessages.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.maxMessagesPerPoll
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.maxMessages.description: The maximum number of messages to return. Amazon SQS never returns more messages than this value (however, fewer messages might be returned). Valid values 1 to 10. Default 1.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.waitTimeSec.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.waitTimeSeconds
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.waitTimeSec.description: The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning. If a message is available, the call returns sooner than WaitTimeSeconds. If no messages are available and the wait time expires, the call does not return a message list.

camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.visibilityT.name: camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.visibilityTimeout
camel.kamelet.aws-sqs-source.visibilityT.description: The duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent retrieve requests after being retrieved by a ReceiveMessage request.
